result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing genitals to a child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: If revoked, defendant is allowed release for HOC programs and HOC work opportunities, and release for school if already enrolled prior to being revoked.

miscConds.notes: Enroll in GED/HSED program full time, or be employed at full time job (40 hours per week).

Maintain absolute sobriety, absolutely no drugs or alcohol. If defendant is prescribed any medication, he is to inform the agent BEFORE getting the prescription filled. Continue taking ADHD medication as ordered; Defendant is to provide name of doctor and a phone number to agent.
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Bail on deposit to apply.

No contact with the victim. Defendant is not to use any type of social media; If defendant possesses a smartphone, computer, or any other electronic device with access to social media, it is to be made available for the agent to inspect at any time.
Participate in a parenting class. Comply with all rules as set forth by agent. Court set restitution at ZERO.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; to be used at the dsicretion of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked     (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:   03-02-2015        Initials:  AAC

Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.

Defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Exposing Genitals or Pubic Area, contrary to sec. 948.10(1) and (1)(a), 939.50(3)(i) Wis. Stats., a Class I Felony.

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of amended information, waived formal reading, and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant at this time.
Justice Point report - discharge summary- received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Court ordered cash bail increased to $2,500.00. Defendant previously posted $1,000.00. Defendant needs to post an additional $1,500.00 cash bail. Court will NOT forfeit previously posted $1,000.00 cash bail.

Attorney McCandless in court after case was called. Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing date instead of the status date previously scheduled. State notified. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 04/22/2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson in court.  Karl P. Hayes on behalf of Paul Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for calendar call. Court called the case to address stayed warrant issued on 03/28/2014, defendant had not checked in with the deputies prior to case being called. Defendant in court. Discussion regarding justice point violations and missed court appearance on Friday. Arguments heard as to bail. Court increased cash bail to $2,500.00. All other conditions previously ordered remain the same. Clerk notified Attorney McCandless. Case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Victoria M. McCandless in court.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Defendant does not appear. Defense counsel was able to get in contact with the defendant prior to this case being called. Discussion regarding Justice Point report. Court issued but STAYED a warrant until 03/31/2014. Bail remains the same. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Calendar call scheduled for March 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

14RM010609  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/24/14 vf

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson not in court, in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer letter provided to defense counsel.  defense request for plea date, granted.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders other terms and conditions to remain the same.

Stipulation to a bail modification is agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.  
Court AMENDS bail to $1000 CASH.

Defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with I.W. (DOB:  06/29/1998).

Defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson in court with attorney Ravae Sinclair.  Defendant Kevin J Wiggison-Stevenson in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
